author: Patrick Souza
title: How to Get 180 Free Pulls in Zenless Zone Zero (ZZZ)
text:
Zenless Zone Zero is off to a great start by offering new players up to 180 free pulls (with 80 of them being Boopons) to get a huge start in the newest title. Here’s how you can get all of these rewards for yourself by only playing a bit of the game.
Where to Get The 180 Free Pulls in Zenless Zone Zero The 180 free pulls are obtained through various separate events celebrating the Zenless Zone Zero release. Some of them are, for example, pre-registration rewards (distributed for all players on release), while others are temporarily redeemable codes.
The free pulls also alternate between the Encrypted Master Tape (for Exclusive Channel), Master Tape (for Standard Channel) and Boopons (for An Outstanding Partner). 10 pulls are given directly as Polychrome, the game’s general currency which you can decide which banner to roll.
x20 Encrypted Master Tape You can get the premium currency in the game through several starter events:
x10 through the New City Visitor’s Passport Event x10 through the Sixth City Giveaway Event Both events are simple daily login reward events, in which all you need to do is to keep entering the game for seven days to claim the Tapes. The Sixth City Giveaway only starts on July 11th, but both events will end on August 13th (the debut update’s final day), so you have plenty of time to claim them.
Related: What Time is Daily Reset in Zenless Zone Zero (ZZZ)?
x70 Master Tape The Master Tapes, which are a huge part of the 100 free pulls in Zenless Zone Zero, are obtained through the following events:
x20 via Pre-Registration rewards; x10 via Cunning Generosity event; x40 via Road to Proxy Greatness event. Pre-registration rewards are granted to all players as soon as they log in for the first time, while both other events are directly tied to natural progression. The Cunning Generosity gives you extra pulls as soon as you reach Level 8 and unlock the Events tab (valid until August 13th as well), while the Road to Proxy Greatness event rewards you every 5 levels past 5 (skipping 10). This last one is a permanent event, while the pre-registration rewards are available for six months.
Screenshot via The Escapist x1600 Polychrome The Polychrome reward is also part of the Road to Proxy Greatness event. It is awarded by reaching Level 30, after you get all the other regular Master Tapes.
x80 Boopons The special currency used to get more Bangboos is awarded throughout the same events previously mentioned, plus an exclusive one:
x10 via “Eh-Nap” Into Your Lap Event; x65 via Road to Proxy Greatness; x5 via pre-registration rewards. The “Eh-Nap” Into Your Lap is the third daily login event for the game’s release, also finishing on August 13th. Just log in after you unlock the event to get the spoils daily.
These pulls will surely give you a good start in the game, especially if you’re lucky enough to get a S-Rank or two with them. And don’t forget to also redeem your codes for even more goods, as extra items are never enough.

author: Von dpa
title: Tunneleinsturz in Los Angeles: 31 Arbeiter gerettet
text:
Schnelle Rettung
Tunneleinsturz in Los Angeles: 31 Arbeiter gerettet
Los Angeles (dpa)
Die Sorge ist zunächst groß, als erste Meldungen über einen Tunneleinsturz in Kalifornien bekannt wurden. Doch eine Katastrophe ist ausgeblieben.
Aufatmen in Kalifornien: Nach dem Einsturz eines Tunnels im Großraum der US-Metropole Los Angeles hat die Feuerwehr alle Eingeschlossenen bergen können. 31 Menschen, wohl alle Tunnelarbeiter, seien am Mittwochabend (Ortszeit) lebend und ohne sichtbare Verletzungen gerettet worden, teilte die Feuerwehr mit. Der Unglücksort befindet etwa 30 Kilometer südlich des Zentrums von Los Angeles.
Ersten Berichten der Feuerwehr zufolge gelang es einigen Arbeitern nach dem Einsturz, über einen Berg loser Erde zu klettern. Auf der anderen Seite trafen sie demnach auf Kollegen. Anschließend seien die Eingeschlossenen mit einem Tunneltransportmittel zum Ausgang gebracht worden. Sanitäter versorgten daraufhin die Geretteten und untersuchten sie genauer, hieß es.
Ein großer Rettungseinsatz
Mehr als 100 Einsatzkräfte waren nach Angaben der Feuerwehr zum Unglücksort geeilt, darunter spezialisierte Rettungsteams. Der Einsturz passierte demnach mehr als acht Kilometer vom einzigen Tunneleingang entfernt. Es handele sich um einen im Bau befindlichen Tunnel für die kommunale Abwasserentsorgung, hieß es weiter. Die Ermittlungen zur Ursache des Einsturzes dauern an.
Etwa eine Stunde waren die Arbeiter in dem Tunnel eingeschlossen, meldete CBS News. Der Tunnel sei insgesamt mehr als 11 Kilometer lang und etwas mehr als fünf Meter breit, schrieb der US-Sender unter Berufung auf den Betreiber.

author: Ignacio Guerra
title: Escaparon contra el sentido del tránsito: Persecución en Peñalolén termina con tres detenidos y dos armas incautadas
text:
Personal de Carabineros logró este jueves la detención de tres sujetos que circulaban en un vehículo con encargo vigente por robo, quienes al momento de su captura portaban dos pistolas adaptadas para el disparo.
De acuerdo a información policial, todo comenzó cuando una patrulla que se movilizaba por las calles de Peñalolén se percató de un automóvil que transitaba sin sus placas patentes, por lo que procedieron a iniciar un seguimiento controlado.
No obstante, al percatarse de la presencia de Carabineros, los individuos decidieron escapar, iniciándose una persecución que culminó en la rotonda Grecia, justo en la intersección con Av. Américo Vespucio.
Allí, los sujetos incluso condujeron contra el sentido del tránsito, pero terminaron perdiendo el control en la berma. Carabineros detuvo a dos adultos y un menor de 17 años, todos con antecedentes previos. Según la policía, el adolescente estaba con una medida cautelar de arresto domiciliario nocturno por un robo con intimidación.
La capitán Emma Moreno, de la 43° Comisaría de Peñalolén, detalló que el hecho ocurrió a eso de las 17:40 horas, y que el automóvil en que se movilizaban los antisociales mantenía encargo vigente por robo desde el martes.
"Una vez realizada la revisión del vehículo nos podemos percatar que mantenían dos armamentos de fantasía adaptados para el disparo, y a su vez el vehículo tenía encargo por robo", indicó.

author: Wycliffe Musalia
title: William Ruto's Govt Secures Jobs in Saudi Arabia for Kenyans, Monthly Salary
text: Kenya Govt Announces Jobs in Saudi Arabia for Kenyans, Monthly Salary - President William Ruto promised to secure jobs abroad for thousands of unemployed Kenyans - The Ministry of Labour and Social Protection announced jobs in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA) for professional Kenyans in the field of nursing and personal/healthcare assistance - Qualified candidates will be paid a salary range of between KSh 92,000 to KSh 146,000 based on the job category [PAY ATTENTION: We Need your Opinion! What do You Think about this Website? Take 5-min Poll and Make TUKO Better Now.](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScq-otrn1gxAfj5qwGa5dC94idDtj7xdUc23m5gsoywQTnlZA/viewform) TUKO.co.ke journalist Wycliffe Musalia brings over five years of experience in financial, [business](https://www.tuko.co.ke/business-economy/), and technology reporting, offering deep insights into Kenyan and global economic trends. The government has announced job opportunities in Saudi Arabia for Kenyans. This followed President William Ruto's visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA) in November 2023. How many abroad jobs did Ruto secure? The head of state revealed that he had secured an agreement with the Saudi Arabian government to [export 2,500 skilled labourers](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/531485-william-ruto-claims-s-secured-2500-jobs-kenyans-saudi-arabia-na-mshahara-ni-mnono/). PAY ATTENTION: Celebrate Kenyan changemakers with TUKO.co.ke! [Read more about BUSINESS LEADERS AWARDS 2023](https://kenyan-business-leaders-tuko-award.webflow.io/) In a public notice released on Tuesday, January 2, the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection called for applications for Kenyans to work in KSA nursing and personal healthcare sectors. "...we request for applications from qualified Kenyans for employment in the KSA as General Nurses and Personal Assistant/Healthcare Assistant professionals," read the notice signed by Labour PS Shadrack Mwadime in part. What are the nursing job requirements? Mwadime specified that applicants should be Kenyan citizens, female, and aged between 22 and 35 years. They should be registered and licensed members of the Nursing Council of Kenya with good standing. Those with a degree should have a minimum of two years of continuous experience, while diploma holders should have zero experience (graduate entry is accepted). [Certificate in nursing](https://www.tuko.co.ke/348721-certificate-nursing-kenya-requirements-colleges-offering-fees.html) graduates should have a minimum of one year of continuous work experience. Qualified candidates must be proficient in English, both writing and speaking, physically fit and hold a valid [Kenyan passport](https://www.tuko.co.ke/268978-kenyan-passport-tracking.html). They must have a valid and latest licence or employment certificate. What is the monthly salary for a nurse in Saudi? Once selected, the applicants must have valid prometric test results, which can be taken in [Kenya](https://kiswahili.tuko.co.ke/tags/siasa-za-kenya/) of KSA with a fee deducted from the salary in three instalments. The job terms are [pegged on a contract of two years](https://www.tuko.co.ke/business-economy/526301-william-ruto-promises-kenyans-350000-jobs-saudi-arabia-wamesema-mko-na-bidii-mjipange/), renewable. Workers have eight hours on duty with a monthly pay of 2,200 riyals (KSh 92,000) for certificate holders. Diploma holders earn a monthly salary of 3,000 riyals (KSh 125,000) while degree holders earn 3,500 riyals (KSh 146,000). Source: TUKO.co.ke

organizations.name: monthly salary kenya govt announces jobs

author: Jessica Nix
title: Bird Flu Kills Dairy Workers' Cats, Suggesting a Viral Change
text:
Two house cats died after contracting bird flu in the homes of dairy workers, a troubling sign that the virus may be moving between species and becoming more widespread.
The cats’ owners lived in separate households in Michigan and developed symptoms of H5N1 last May, according to a report released Thursday by the
While human infections have been rare during the current outbreak of H5N1 bird flu, with a single death, ...

author: 時報資訊
title: 《經濟》核三廠火警冒濃煙 擔憂輻射外洩？台電回應了
text:
時報資訊 《經濟》核三廠火警冒濃煙 擔憂輻射外洩？台電回應了 閱讀全文
時報資訊 2025年3月6日 上午6:46 【時報-台北電】核三廠今(6日)天發生火警，現場冒出大量濃煙，台電回應，是空壓機廠房南側冷卻水塔起火，離發電機有50公尺遠，不影響發電及爐心安全，現場狀況已受到控制，無輻射外洩疑慮。
台電表示，今日上午11時23分接獲通報，核三廠空壓機廠房南側發生冷卻水塔(地面直立，直徑3米、高度3米，塑膠材質)火警事件，不影響發電及爐心安全。廠內消防隊迅速展開滅火行動，並於11時35分撲滅火勢，現場狀況已受到控制。（新聞來源：中時即時 王玉樹）

author: Paul Liberatore
title: Narada Michael Walden’s musical and spiritual life captured in new book – Marin Independent Journal
text:
Share this: Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window) Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to print (Opens in new window) Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Marin’s Narada Michael Walden is the subject of a new book. (Photo by Paul Liberatore) By Paul Liberatore | p.liberatore@comcast.net | IJ correspondent UPDATED: September 19, 2024 at 12:52 p.m. In his long and acclaimed career, Marin’s Narada Michael Walden is known primarily as a three-time Grammy-winning record producer who churned out hits for some of the biggest names in pop: legends like Aretha Franklin, Whitney Houston and Mariah Carey.
In 1987, two years after he opened his Tarpan Studios in San Rafael, he won the Grammy for producer of the year, non-classical, a prestigious award that has been bestowed on the likes of Quincy Jones, Rick Rubin and, most recently, Jack Antonoff for his work with Taylor Swift.
Walden’s success as a producer, though, has sometimes overshadowed his prominence as a world-class musician, a jazz-rock fusion drummer who has toured and recorded with such greats as British guitarist John McLaughlin and his groundbreaking Mahavishnu Orchestra, the jazz fusion group Weather Report and Hall of Fame rock guitarist Jeff Beck.
A new coffee table book, “Narada Michael Walden: Drumming, Spirit and Music” (Hudson Music, $29.99), shines a light on the 72-year-old’s life as a musician, beginning with his childhood in Michigan as a drum prodigy and his career-defining association with McLaughlin, who introduced him to his guru, Sri Chinmoy, an Indian spiritual leader and meditation teacher who gave him his spiritual name, Narada (pronounced NAR-duh), Hindu for traveling musician and storyteller.
Written by Canadian drummer Aubrey Dayle, the book is both a biography and a technical manual for drummers featuring transcriptions of Walden’s best-known drum parts.
A graduate of McGill University and the Manhattan School of Music, Dayle, who’s 60 and lives in Toronto, has been a fan of Walden’s drumming since he was a teenager.
“Narada’s my hero,” he says. “As a teenager just learning how to play, he was super inspirational. He’s a groundbreaking drummer.”
The book is designed to appeal to casual music fans as well as drummers and musicians. It’s packed with photos, stories and interviews with fellow musicians, including McLaughlin and former Journey drummer Steve Smith, who credits Walden with creating “a new way to play jazz, with this big rock approach.”
Narada Michael Walden plays with guitar great Jeff Beck. (Courtesy of Narada Michael Walden) Billy Cobham, who played with Miles Davis and the Mahavishnu Orchestra and is widely considered the greatest fusion drummer of all time, wrote the book’s foreword.
Cobham wrote about one of his last concerts with the Mahavishnu Orchestra in 1973 and his first encounter with Walden, the then-21-year-old drummer he didn’t know at the time would succeed him in the band.
“Sitting behind me and my drum kit on the stage floor is a young man with his eyes closed, a smile that indicates total bliss and a full commitment to be exactly where he wanted to be right then,” Cobham wrote, adding, “In Narada, there was a positive image that he projected to all whenever I was around him.”
During an interview about the book last week in the memorabilia-stuffed control room of his San Rafael studio, Walden reminisced, at times emotionally, about his devotion to Sri Chinmoy, who died in 2007, his reverence for McLaughlin, who’s now 82 and lives in Monaco, and those heady days of spirituality and musical exploration at the dawn of his career.
Sitting in an overstuffed leather easy chair, he was wearing one of his signature sleeveless vests and a shiny golden military-style hat of the kind he wore when he was in his high school marching band in Kalamazoo, Michigan, his hometown.
He remembered the come-to-God moment when he first heard McLaughlin and Cobham playing a concert in Hartford, Connecticut, that was ear-splittingly loud, but nevertheless precise and clean, combining jazz, rock and funk with unfamiliar Indian influences into an exotic brew that he had never imagined let alone heard before.
”Their playing was so fierce for so long that I was like, you’ve got to change your life, you’ve got to be like this,” he says. “This is what you’re looking for. You can live and do this music. This is God’s music. This guy loves God. This is the new way.”
After the show, Walden talked his way backstage, hardly believing his luck when he wrangled an introduction to the guitar god he had just seen on stage.
“I swear to you it was like meeting Abraham Lincoln,” he says. “It was like meeting the hero you never thought you were going to meet. And there he was in front of me.”
After Walden told him that he was a drummer and wanted to be able to play the kind of divine music he’d heard him play that night, McLaughlin arranged for him to meet Sri Chinmoy. During that first encounter, Walden was graciously accepted into the guru’s fold.
“As he walked away, I felt within me deep gratitude,” he says. “It kind of hit me hard, these eruptions of gratitude or love or whatever those things are. I couldn’t process it all. It was bigger than my mind, bigger than anything I knew.”
After becoming a disciple, he had to wait three years, longer than usual, before the guru would give him his spiritual name during a ceremony called “God’s hour.”
“I look at this book and that’s what hits me,” he says. “This whole name thing is something I cherish. But it didn’t come easy for me.”
Right around this same time, he remembers, he played his first impromptu jam session with McLaughlin, who was already a top echelon jazz guitarist and a veteran of Miles Davis’ band, having played on Davis’ historic early electric jazz fusion albums, including “Bitches Brew,” a milestone 1970 record that made musical history as a progenitor of jazz rock.
Narada Michael Walden plays with guitarist John McLaughlin and his Mahavishnu Orchestra in the mid-1970s. (Courtesy of Narada Michael Walden) The session took place in McLaughlin’s vegetarian restaurant with McLaughlin playing an acoustic guitar and Walden, who didn’t have his drums with him, beating out the rhythm on the guitar case.
“I think he was playing in some odd meter, but I could hang with him,” he says. “And that was my first test.”
The next one came when McLaughlin jammed with Walden and some other musicians in a barn on a farm in Canaan, Connecticut, where Walden was living.
Walden’s voice quavers with emotion when he describes a solo that McLaughlin took during that life-altering session.
“What he does is he looks at me with a face I had never seen before, a stone face, and the sound was enormous, like Jimi Hendrix,” says Walden, choking back tears. “I said to myself, ‘I am not going to let this man freak me out.’ So I closed my eyes and then I was fine. I could play and get out there and roar with him. But he was trying to freak me out and it was terrifying. To this day, it freaks me out. He was really just trying to see what kind of man I was, that’s what I think.”
Whatever his reason, McLaughlin would ask him to join the band after Cobham left. Walden would tour internationally with the Mahavishnu Orchestra for three years and record three albums, “Apocalypse” in 1974, “Visions of the Emerald Beyond” in 1975 and “Inner Worlds” in 1976.
That experience, portrayed in the new book, would turn Walden into the powerhouse drummer he became and would give him the spiritual foundation that has sustained him through the rest of his life and career.
“That saved me,” he says. “At the time, I thought, ‘I’m going to live.’ It saved my life.”
Contact Paul Liberatore at p.liberatore@comcast.net
